alert.note: Alert for Jackson; Lincoln (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 06 at 3:25PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN JACKSON AND LINCOLN PARISHES THROUGH 400 PM CDT... At 325 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Ruston, moving southwest at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Ruston, Grambling, Dubach, Simsboro, Vienna, Mount Zion, and Unionville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
